climbs.name: X Marks The Spot
climbs.fa: Bob and Duick Bowman-1986 Ground Up

content.description: On west face start to the left of roof. Climb up the flake / crack to where it forms a "X" and bolts.
content.protection: Cams- Yellow C3-#2 Camalot Nuts 2-Bolts 2-Bolt Chain Anchor on Top

climbs.name: Short Rib
climbs.fa: Mark Jacobs, Ian Pressler-1986 Ground Up

content.description: This is a seldom done short bolted route on the north ridge of Reef #2.  It really is high quality - I gave it only 1 star because it is so short.  This route used to have 1 bolt on it, but someone added an additional one recently.  If memory serves me correctly, the only anchors are those at the top of New Number Nine.  Use these, and rap with only 1 rope.
Start at the dike to the first bolt. Make a few 5.7 moves to get to a blank face. Make a move or two on the friction slab to reach the top.
content.location: The furthest route up the gully that divides Reef #2 and Reef #3.

content.description: Climb the low angle slab to the first bolt that's quite a ways off the deck. Climbing get steeper now, so pinch those crystals all the way to the top.
content.location: First route you come to in the gully between Reef #2 and Reef #3 when approached from the North.

content.description: Start by climbing the dike for a few bolts. Then grab some sharp crystals for a few more. The crux is a fairly good sloper near the top of the climb. Good variety of climbing on this route.
content.location: About 30 feet up the gully dividing Reef #2 and Reef #3. Just to the right of Pre-Marital Sex.

content.description: Awkward start and kind of dirty. The finish is a little bit of fun.
content.protection: Cams - Red C3-#1 Nuts 2-Bolts 2-Bolt Chain Anchor on Top
content.location: Route is on the east face of of reef #2.

content.description: On the southeast side of Reef #2 is a narrow fin of rock called X Marks the Spot.  On the east side of the fin is an obvious thin crack that leads into a pod.  Climb up the thin crack and through the pod.  When this ends,  climb up to the top using the arete on the left.  This goes past two bolts.  Rap using one rope from fixed anchors at the top.
content.protection: Cams- Green C3- #1 Nuts Micro-Nuts 2-Bolts 2-Bolt Chain Anchor on Top

content.description: This is the first system of rocks directly behind Reef #1.  Its west face is tightly squeezed up next to the minor formation behind Reef #1.  There is a few fun routes on it, most notably New Number Nine, and Ankles Away (on the subsummit called X Marks the Spot).  This formation is rather complicated with gullies and several highpoints.  The main summit is to the northwest, and "X Marks the Spot" is the steep, narrow fin of rock on the southeast part of the formation.  Also, another minor summit in between on the east face has a route named Coral Reef on it.
